content: The "Agricultural Trade Reform Act of 1999" may be cited as the short title. The definition of domestic industry is provided in the Act. The "Agricultural Trade Reform Act of 1999" defines domestic industry as producers of like or competitive articles or perishable agricultural products in specific geographic areas of the United States. It also amends Section 202(c)(6) to clarify that a significant portion of the domestic industry means an important part of the industry in the United States, and specifies that a specific geographic area refers to a distinct area where perishable agricultural, citrus, or potato products are produced. The "Agricultural Trade Reform Act of 1999" defines domestic industry as producers of like or competitive articles in specific geographic areas of the United States. It clarifies that a significant portion of the domestic industry means an important part of the industry in the United States, characterized by production in the same growing season. SEC. 3. PROVISIONAL RELIEF. Section 202(d)(1)(C) of the Trade Act of 1974 is amended to allow for provisional relief in cases of alleged injury from imports of perishable agricultural products, citrus products, or potato products that have been monitored by the Commission for at least 90 days. Requests for provisional relief can be made by petition or by the President, Trade Representative, or relevant committees. The Commission must make a determination within 21 days of a request regarding whether increased imports of perishable agricultural products, citrus products, or potato products are causing serious injury to the domestic industry. This determination considers if the injury is difficult to repair due to perishability or if timely prevention is not possible through investigation. The Commission may waive the 90-day monitoring requirement in certain cases when considering a petition, request, or resolution if there is evidence of significant increases in production or production capacity in the country of import. The text discusses amendments to the Trade Act of 1974 regarding imports causing serious injury to domestic industries. Amendments include changes to reporting requirements and definitions of agricultural products. Amendments to the Trade Act of 1974 include defining "potato product" as any processed potato product.
